bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Dragging around the Google map from http://pskreporter.info/ for a bit, in an X session, eventually causes firefox to crash with a Gdk-ERROR BadAccess
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
firefox-50.0.2-1.fc25.x86_64
Steps to Reproduce: 1. go to https://www.pskreporter.info/pskmap.html?preset&callsign=ab1kw&timerange=86400&hideunrec=1 2. zoom in a little and drag around the map until firefox crashes 3. watch backtrace
Expected results:
Firefox works, like it used to before.
Additional info:
$ firefox WARNING: content window passed to PrivateBrowsingUtils.isWindowPrivate. Use isContentWindowPrivate instead (but only for frame scripts). pbu_isWindowPrivate@resource://gre/modules/PrivateBrowsingUtils.jsm:25:14 privateTab.isPrivateWindow@resource://gre/modules/addons/XPIProvider.jsm -> jar:file:///home/riel/.mozilla/firefox/x1fnjx2x.default/extensions/privateTab@infocatcher.xpi!/bootstrap.js:4183:20 privateTab.isPrivateContent@resource://gre/modules/addons/XPIProvider.jsm -> jar:file:///home/riel/.mozilla/firefox/x1fnjx2x.default/extensions/privateTab@infocatcher.xpi!/bootstrap.js:4188:11 before@resource://gre/modules/addons/XPIProvider.jsm -> jar:file:///home/riel/.mozilla/firefox/x1fnjx2x.default/extensions/privateTab@infocatcher.xpi!/bootstrap.js:4104:23 wrapper@chrome://privatetab/content/patcher.jsm:36:16 get enabled@chrome://browser/content/browser-trackingprotection.js:49:13 updateEnabled@chrome://browser/content/browser-trackingprotection.js:57:29 init@chrome://browser/content/browser-trackingprotection.js:24:5 gBrowserInit.onLoad@chrome://browser/content/browser.js:972:5 onload@chrome://browser/content/browser.xul:1:1 WARNING: content window passed to PrivateBrowsingUtils.isWindowPrivate. (firefox:29887): Gdk-ERROR **: The program 'firefox' received an X Window System error. This probably reflects a bug in the program. The error was 'BadAccess (attempt to access private resource denied)'. (Details: serial 7790 error_code 10 request_code 130 (MIT-SHM) minor_code 1) (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously; that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it. To debug your program, run it with the GDK_SYNCHRONIZE environment variable to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.) Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)
Firefox 50.1.0 which is in koji now should fix that.
firefox-50.1.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-f115a880a6
firefox-50.1.0-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-85eae56259
firefox-50.1.0-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-bd94ef48c8

firefox-50.1.0-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
